00079 /*********************************************************************/
00084 void CAN_IRQHandler(void)
00085 {
00086         uint8_t IntStatus;
00087         //check FullCAN interrupt enable or not
00088         if(CAN_FullCANIntGetStatus(LPC_CANAF)== SET)
00089         {       //check is FullCAN interrupt occurs or not
00090                 if ((CAN_FullCANPendGetStatus(LPC_CANAF,FULLCAN_IC0))
00091                                 ||(CAN_FullCANPendGetStatus(LPC_CANAF,FULLCAN_IC1)))
00092                 {
00093                         //read received FullCAN Object in Object Section
00094                         FCAN_ReadObj(LPC_CANAF, &AFRxMsg[CANRxCount]);
00095                         CANRxCount++;
00096                 }
00097         }
00098         /* get interrupt status
00099          * Note that: Interrupt register CANICR will be reset after read.
00100          * So function "CAN_IntGetStatus" should be call only one time
00101          */
00102         IntStatus = CAN_IntGetStatus(LPC_CAN2);
00103         //check receive interrupt
00104         if((IntStatus>>0)&0x01)
00105         {
00106                 CAN_ReceiveMsg(LPC_CAN2, &AFRxMsg[CANRxCount]);
00107                 CANRxCount++;
00108         }
00109 }

00112 /*********************************************************************/
00117 void PrintMessage(CAN_MSG_Type* CAN_Msg)
00118 {
00119         uint32_t data;
00120         _DBG("Message ID:     ");
00121         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->id);_DBG_("");
00122         _DBG("Message length: ");
00123         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->len);_DBG_(" BYTES");
00124         _DBG("Message type:   ");
00125         if(CAN_Msg->type==DATA_FRAME)
00126         {
00127                 _DBG_("DATA FRAME ");
00128         }
00129         else
00130                 _DBG_("REMOTE FRAME ");
00131         _DBG("Message format: ");
00132         if(CAN_Msg->format==STD_ID_FORMAT)
00133         {
00134                 _DBG_("STANDARD ID FRAME FORMAT");
00135         }
00136         else
00137                 _DBG_("EXTENDED ID FRAME FORMAT");
00138         _DBG("Message dataA:  ");
00139         data = (CAN_Msg->dataA[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataA[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[3]<<24);
00140         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00141         data = (CAN_Msg->dataB[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataB[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[3]<<24);
00142         _DBG("Message dataB:  ");
00143         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00144         _DBG_("");
00145 }

00158 void CAN_SetupAFTable(void) {
00159         FullCAN_Table[0].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00160         FullCAN_Table[0].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00161         FullCAN_Table[0].id_11 = 0x01;
00162         FullCAN_Table[1].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00163         FullCAN_Table[1].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00164         FullCAN_Table[1].id_11 = 0x02;
00165         FullCAN_Table[2].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00166         FullCAN_Table[2].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00167         FullCAN_Table[2].id_11 = 0x03;
00168         FullCAN_Table[3].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00169         FullCAN_Table[3].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00170         FullCAN_Table[3].id_11 = 0x06;
00171         FullCAN_Table[4].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00172         FullCAN_Table[4].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00173         FullCAN_Table[4].id_11 = 0x0C;
00174         FullCAN_Table[5].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00175         FullCAN_Table[5].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00176         FullCAN_Table[5].id_11 = 0x0D;
00177 
00178         SFF_Table[0].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00179         SFF_Table[0].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00180         SFF_Table[0].id_11 = 0x08;
00181         SFF_Table[1].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00182         SFF_Table[1].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00183         SFF_Table[1].id_11 = 0x09;
00184         SFF_Table[2].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00185         SFF_Table[2].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00186         SFF_Table[2].id_11 = 0x0A;
00187         SFF_Table[3].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00188         SFF_Table[3].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00189         SFF_Table[3].id_11 = 0x0B;
00190         SFF_Table[4].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00191         SFF_Table[4].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00192         SFF_Table[4].id_11 = 0x0E;
00193         SFF_Table[5].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00194         SFF_Table[5].disable = MSG_ENABLE;
00195         SFF_Table[5].id_11 = 0x0F;
00196 
00197         SFF_GPR_Table[0].controller1 = SFF_GPR_Table[0].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00198         SFF_GPR_Table[0].disable1 = SFF_GPR_Table[0].disable2 = MSG_ENABLE;
00199         SFF_GPR_Table[0].lowerID = 0x10;
00200         SFF_GPR_Table[0].upperID = 0x20;
00201         SFF_GPR_Table[1].controller1 = SFF_GPR_Table[1].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00202         SFF_GPR_Table[1].disable1 = SFF_GPR_Table[1].disable2 = MSG_ENABLE;
00203         SFF_GPR_Table[1].lowerID = 0x20;

00206         SFF_GPR_Table[2].disable1 = SFF_GPR_Table[2].disable2 = MSG_ENABLE;
00207         SFF_GPR_Table[2].lowerID = 0x30;
00208         SFF_GPR_Table[2].upperID = 0x40;
00209         SFF_GPR_Table[3].controller1 = SFF_GPR_Table[3].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00210         SFF_GPR_Table[3].disable1 = SFF_GPR_Table[3].disable2 = MSG_ENABLE;
00211         SFF_GPR_Table[3].lowerID = 0x40;
00212         SFF_GPR_Table[3].upperID = 0x50;
00213         SFF_GPR_Table[4].controller1 = SFF_GPR_Table[4].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00214         SFF_GPR_Table[4].disable1 = SFF_GPR_Table[4].disable2 = MSG_ENABLE;
00215         SFF_GPR_Table[4].lowerID = 0x50;
00216         SFF_GPR_Table[4].upperID = 0x60;
00217         SFF_GPR_Table[5].controller1 = SFF_GPR_Table[5].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00218         SFF_GPR_Table[5].disable1 = SFF_GPR_Table[5].disable2 = MSG_ENABLE;
00219         SFF_GPR_Table[5].lowerID = 0x60;
00220         SFF_GPR_Table[5].upperID = 0x70;
00221 
00222         EFF_Table[0].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00223         EFF_Table[0].ID_29 = (1 << 11);
00224         EFF_Table[1].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00225         EFF_Table[1].ID_29 = (2 << 11);
00226         EFF_Table[2].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00227         EFF_Table[2].ID_29 = (3 << 11);
00228         EFF_Table[3].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00229         EFF_Table[3].ID_29 = (4 << 11);
00230         EFF_Table[4].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00231         EFF_Table[4].ID_29 = (0x0e << 11);
00232         EFF_Table[5].controller = CAN2_CTRL;
00233         EFF_Table[5].ID_29 = (0x0f << 11);
00234 
00235         EFF_GPR_Table[0].controller1 = EFF_GPR_Table[0].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00236         EFF_GPR_Table[0].lowerEID = (5 << 11);
00237         EFF_GPR_Table[0].upperEID = (6 << 11);
00238         EFF_GPR_Table[1].controller1 = EFF_GPR_Table[1].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00239         EFF_GPR_Table[1].lowerEID = (7 << 11);
00240         EFF_GPR_Table[1].upperEID = (8 << 11);
00241         EFF_GPR_Table[2].controller1 = EFF_GPR_Table[2].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00242         EFF_GPR_Table[2].lowerEID = (9 << 11);
00243         EFF_GPR_Table[2].upperEID = (0x0a << 11);
00244         EFF_GPR_Table[3].controller1 = EFF_GPR_Table[3].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00245         EFF_GPR_Table[3].lowerEID = (0x0b << 11);
00246         EFF_GPR_Table[3].upperEID = (0x0c << 11);
00247         EFF_GPR_Table[4].controller1 = EFF_GPR_Table[4].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00248         EFF_GPR_Table[4].lowerEID = (0x11 << 11);
00249         EFF_GPR_Table[4].upperEID = (0x12 << 11);
00250         EFF_GPR_Table[5].controller1 = EFF_GPR_Table[5].controller2 = CAN2_CTRL;
00251         EFF_GPR_Table[5].lowerEID = (0x13 << 11);
00252         EFF_GPR_Table[5].upperEID = (0x14 << 11);
00253 
00254         AFTable.FullCAN_Sec = &FullCAN_Table[0];
00255         AFTable.FC_NumEntry = 6;
00256         AFTable.SFF_Sec = &SFF_Table[0];
00257         AFTable.SFF_NumEntry = 6;

00260         AFTable.EFF_Sec = &EFF_Table[0];

00264 }
00265 /*********************************************************************/
00270 void CAN_ChangeAFTable(void)
00271 {
00272         CAN_LoadFullCANEntry(LPC_CAN2, 4);
00273         CAN_LoadExplicitEntry(LPC_CAN2, 5, STD_ID_FORMAT);
00274         CAN_LoadGroupEntry(LPC_CAN2,0x25,0x30, STD_ID_FORMAT);
00275         CAN_LoadExplicitEntry(LPC_CAN2, (3<<11)+0x05, EXT_ID_FORMAT);
00276         CAN_LoadGroupEntry(LPC_CAN2,(0x0a<<11),(0x0b<<11), EXT_ID_FORMAT);
00277 
00278         CAN_RemoveEntry(FULLCAN_ENTRY, 0);
00279         CAN_RemoveEntry(EXPLICIT_STANDARD_ENTRY, 0);
00280         CAN_RemoveEntry(GROUP_STANDARD_ENTRY, 0);
00281         CAN_RemoveEntry(EXPLICIT_EXTEND_ENTRY, 2);
00282         CAN_RemoveEntry(GROUP_EXTEND_ENTRY, 2);
00283 
00284 }
00285 /*********************************************************************/
00293 void CAN_InitAFMessage(void) {
00294         /* 1st Message with 11-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table in FullCAN Section */
00295         AFTxMsg[0].id = 0x01;
00296         AFTxMsg[0].len = 0x08;
00297         AFTxMsg[0].type = DATA_FRAME;
00298         AFTxMsg[0].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00299         AFTxMsg[0].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[0].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[0].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[0].dataA[3]= 0x78;
00300         AFTxMsg[0].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[0].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[0].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[0].dataB[3]= 0x21;
00301 
00302         /* 2nd Message with 11-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table */
00303         AFTxMsg[1].id = 0x04;
00304         AFTxMsg[1].len = 0x08;
00305         AFTxMsg[1].type = DATA_FRAME;
00306         AFTxMsg[1].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00307         AFTxMsg[1].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[1].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[1].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[1].dataA[3]= 0x23;
00308         AFTxMsg[1].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[1].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[1].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[1].dataB[3]= 0x45;
00309 
00310         /* 3th Message with 11-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table in SFF Section*/
00311         AFTxMsg[2].id = 0x08;
00312         AFTxMsg[2].len = 0x08;
00313         AFTxMsg[2].type = DATA_FRAME;
00314         AFTxMsg[2].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00315         AFTxMsg[2].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[2].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[2].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[2].dataA[3]= 0x15;
00316         AFTxMsg[2].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[2].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[2].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[2].dataB[3]= 0x36;
00317 
00318         /* 4th Message with 11-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table */
00319         AFTxMsg[3].id = 0x05;
00320         AFTxMsg[3].len = 0x08;
00321         AFTxMsg[3].type = DATA_FRAME;
00322         AFTxMsg[3].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00323         AFTxMsg[3].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[3].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[3].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[3].dataA[3]= 0x78;
00324         AFTxMsg[3].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[3].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[3].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[3].dataB[3]= 0x21;
00325 
00326         /* 5th Message with 11-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table in Group SFF Section*/
00327         AFTxMsg[4].id = 0x15;
00328         AFTxMsg[4].len = 0x08;
00329         AFTxMsg[4].type = DATA_FRAME;
00330         AFTxMsg[4].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00331         AFTxMsg[4].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[4].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[4].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[4].dataA[3]= 0x65;
00332         AFTxMsg[4].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[4].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[4].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[4].dataB[3]= 0x37;
00333 
00334         /* 6th Message with 11-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table */
00335         AFTxMsg[5].id = 0x26;
00336         AFTxMsg[5].len = 0x08;
00337         AFTxMsg[5].type = DATA_FRAME;
00338         AFTxMsg[5].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00339         AFTxMsg[5].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[5].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[5].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[5].dataA[3]= 0x76;
00340         AFTxMsg[5].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[5].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[5].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[5].dataB[3]= 0x32;
00341 
00342         /* 7th Message with 29-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table in EFF Section */
00343         AFTxMsg[6].id = (3 << 11); //0x00001800
00344         AFTxMsg[6].len = 0x08;
00345         AFTxMsg[6].type = DATA_FRAME;
00346         AFTxMsg[6].format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00347         AFTxMsg[6].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[6].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[6].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[6].dataA[3]= 0x45;
00348         AFTxMsg[6].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[6].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[6].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[6].dataB[3]= 0x87;
00349 
00350         /* 8th Message with 29-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table */
00351         AFTxMsg[7].id = (3 << 11) + 0x05; //0x00001801
00352         AFTxMsg[7].len = 0x08;
00353         AFTxMsg[7].type = DATA_FRAME;
00354         AFTxMsg[7].format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00355         AFTxMsg[7].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[7].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[7].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[7].dataA[3]= 0x78;
00356         AFTxMsg[7].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[7].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[7].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[7].dataB[3]= 0x21;
00357 
00358         /* 9th Message with 29-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table in Group of EFF Section*/
00359         AFTxMsg[8].id = (9 << 11) + 0x01; //0x00004801
00360         AFTxMsg[8].len = 0x08;
00361         AFTxMsg[8].type = DATA_FRAME;
00362         AFTxMsg[8].format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00363         AFTxMsg[8].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[8].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[8].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[8].dataA[3]= 0x52;
00364         AFTxMsg[8].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[8].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[8].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[8].dataB[3]= 0x06;
00365 
00366         /* 10th Message with 29-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table */
00367         AFTxMsg[9].id = (0x0A << 11) + 0x01; //0x00005001
00368         AFTxMsg[9].len = 0x08;
00369         AFTxMsg[9].type = DATA_FRAME;
00370         AFTxMsg[9].format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00371         AFTxMsg[9].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[9].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[9].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[9].dataA[3]= 0x85;
00372         AFTxMsg[9].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[9].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[9].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[9].dataB[3]= 0x27;
00373 
00374         AFRxMsg[0].id = AFRxMsg[1].id = AFRxMsg[2].id = AFRxMsg[3].id = AFRxMsg[4].id = 0x00;
00375         AFRxMsg[0].len = AFRxMsg[1].len = AFRxMsg[2].len = AFRxMsg[3].len = AFRxMsg[4].len = 0x00;
00376         AFRxMsg[0].type = AFRxMsg[1].type = AFRxMsg[2].type = AFRxMsg[3].type = AFRxMsg[4].type = 0x00;
00377         AFRxMsg[0].format = AFRxMsg[1].format = AFRxMsg[2].format = AFRxMsg[3].format = AFRxMsg[4].format = 0x00;
00378         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[0] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[0] = AFRxMsg[2].dataA[0] = AFRxMsg[3].dataA[0] = AFRxMsg[4].dataA[0] = 0x00;
00379         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[1] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[1] = AFRxMsg[2].dataA[1] = AFRxMsg[3].dataA[1] = AFRxMsg[4].dataA[1] = 0x00;
00380         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[2] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[2] = AFRxMsg[2].dataA[2] = AFRxMsg[3].dataA[2] = AFRxMsg[4].dataA[2] = 0x00;
00381         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[3] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[3] = AFRxMsg[2].dataA[3] = AFRxMsg[3].dataA[3] = AFRxMsg[4].dataA[3] = 0x00;
00382 
00383         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[0] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[0] = AFRxMsg[2].dataB[0] = AFRxMsg[3].dataB[0] = AFRxMsg[4].dataB[0] = 0x00;
00384         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[1] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[1] = AFRxMsg[2].dataB[1] = AFRxMsg[3].dataB[1] = AFRxMsg[4].dataB[1] = 0x00;
00385         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[2] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[2] = AFRxMsg[2].dataB[2] = AFRxMsg[3].dataB[2] = AFRxMsg[4].dataB[2] = 0x00;
00386         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[3] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[3] = AFRxMsg[2].dataB[3] = AFRxMsg[3].dataB[3] = AFRxMsg[4].dataB[3] = 0x00;
00387 }
00388 /*********************************************************************/
00393 void print_menu()

00395         _DBG_(menu);

00398 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00399 /*********************************************************************/
00404 int c_entry(void) { /* Main Program */
00405         uint32_t i;
00406         uint32_t cnt;
00407         CAN_ERROR error;
00408         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00409 
00410         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00411          *  115200bps
00412          *  8 data bit
00413          *  No parity
00414          *  1 stop bit
00415          *  No flow control
00416          */
00417         debug_frmwrk_init();
00418         print_menu();
00419 
00420         /* Pin configuration
00421          * CAN1: select P0.0 as RD1. P0.1 as TD1
00422          * CAN2: select P2.7 as RD2, P2.8 as RD2
00423          */
00424         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00425         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00426         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00427         PinCfg.Pinnum = 0;
00428         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00429         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00430         PinCfg.Pinnum = 1;
00431         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00432 
00433         PinCfg.Pinnum = 7;
00434         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00435         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00436         PinCfg.Pinnum = 8;
00437         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00438 
00439         //Initialize CAN1 & CAN2
00440         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN1, 125000);
00441         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN2, 125000);
00442 
00443         //Enable Receive Interrupt
00444         CAN_IRQCmd(LPC_CAN2, CANINT_FCE, ENABLE);
00445         CAN_IRQCmd(LPC_CAN2, CANINT_RIE, ENABLE);
00446 
00447         //Enable CAN Interrupt
00448         NVIC_EnableIRQ(CAN_IRQn);
00449 
00450         /* First, we send 10 messages:
00451          * - message 0,2,4,6,8 have id in AFLUT >>> will be received
00452          * - message 1,3,5,7,9 don't have id in AFLUT >>> will be ignored
00453          * Then, we change AFLUT by load/remove entries in AFLUT and re-send messages
00454          * - message 1,3,5,7,9 have id in AFLUT >>> will be received
00455          * - message 0,2,4,6,8 don't have id in AFLUT >>> will be ignored
00456          * Note that: FullCAN Object must be read from FullCAN Object Section next to AFLUT
00457          */
00458         /*-------------------------Init Message & AF Look-up Table------------------------*/
00459 
00460         _DBG_("Test Acceptance Filter function...");
00461         _DBG_("Press '1' to initialize message and AF Loop-up Table...");_DBG_("");
00462         while(_DG !='1');
00463         CAN_InitAFMessage(); /* initialize Transmit Message */
00464         _DBG_("Init message finished!!!");
00465         CAN_SetupAFTable(); /* initialize AF Look-up Table sections*/
00466         error = CAN_SetupAFLUT(LPC_CANAF,&AFTable); /* install AF Look-up Table */
00467         if (error != CAN_OK) {
00468                 _DBG_("Setup AF: ERROR...");
00469                 while (1); // AF Table has error
00470         }
00471         else _DBG_("Setup AF: SUCCESSFUL!!!");_DBG_("");
00472 
00473 
00474         /*-------------------------Send messages------------------------*/
00475         _DBG_("Press '2' to start CAN transferring operation...");_DBG_("");
00476         while(_DG !='2');
00477         for (i = 0; i < CAN_TX_MSG_CNT; i++) {
00478                 CAN_SendMsg(LPC_CAN1, &AFTxMsg[i]);
00479                 PrintMessage(&AFTxMsg[i]);_DBG_("");
00480                 for(cnt=0;cnt<10000;cnt++); //transmit delay
00481                 CANTxCount++;
00482         }
00483         _DBG_("Sending finished !!!");
00484 
00485         /*-------------------------Display Received messages------------------------*/
00486         _DBG_("Press '3' to display received messages...");_DBG_("");
00487         while(_DG !='3');
00488         for (i = 0; i < CAN_RX_MSG_CNT; i++) {
00489                 PrintMessage(&AFRxMsg[i]);_DBG_("");
00490         }
00491 
00492         /*-------------------------Change AFLUT Table --------------------*/
00493         _DBG_("Press '4' to change AF look-up table...");_DBG_("");
00494         while(_DG !='4');
00495         CAN_ChangeAFTable();
00496         _DBG_("Change AFLUT: FINISHED!!!");
00497         CAN_SetAFMode(LPC_CANAF, CAN_eFCAN);
00498         CAN_InitAFMessage();
00499         CANRxCount = CANTxCount = 0;
00500 
00501         /*-------------------------Re-Send messages------------------------*/
00502         _DBG_("Press '5' to re-send messages...");_DBG_("");
00503         while(_DG !='5');
00504         for (i = 0; i < CAN_TX_MSG_CNT; i++) {
00505                 CAN_SendMsg(LPC_CAN1, &AFTxMsg[i]);
00506                 PrintMessage(&AFTxMsg[i]);_DBG_("");
00507                 for(cnt=0;cnt<10000;cnt++); //transmit delay
00508                 CANTxCount++;
00509         }
00510 
00511         /*-------------------------Display received messages------------------------*/
00512         _DBG_("Re-Sending finished !!!");
00513 
00514         _DBG_("Press '6' to display received messages...");_DBG_("");
00515         while(_DG !='6');
00516         for (i = 0; i < CAN_RX_MSG_CNT; i++) {
00517                 PrintMessage(&AFRxMsg[i]);_DBG_("");
00518         }
00519         _DBG_("Demo terminal !!!");
00520 
00521         CAN_DeInit(LPC_CAN1);
00522         CAN_DeInit(LPC_CAN2);
00523         while (1);
00524         return 0;
00525 }
00526 
00527 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00528  allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00529  heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00530  toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00531  file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00532 int main(void) {
00533         return c_entry();
00534 }
00535 
00536 #ifdef  DEBUG

00538  * @brief               Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00539  *                              where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00540  * @param[in]   file Pointer to the source file name
00541  * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00542  * @return              None
00543  *******************************************************************************/
00544 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line) {
00545         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00546          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00547 
00548         /* Infinite loop */
00549         while (1)
00550                 ;
00551 }
